page.title: 04UNUSUAL HOUSING IN MONKLANDS
page.content:
In{Old Monklands}there are two
detached{Mock Tudor Houses.}They are very different from the{four in a {block houses}in which we live and also those in the surrounding area. In{1904,}a man called{Sholto Douglas built a large{Mission House}for his wife in{Mock Tudor style.}Later it was divided into{two semi_detached houses. These houses are unique in the{Old {Monklands}area. The houses are made of{stone and {wood.}Inside{gas central heating}is now used although when they were built heating was probably by{coal fires}as this was a coal mining region. Some of the{furniture}is{Mock Tudor which is very much in keeping with the surroundings.
